org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq

Class FastqFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq.FastqFileReader

  • public final class FastqFileReader
extends Object
    Helper class to simplify the process of reading Fastq encoded files to just get the Stream of FastqRecord objects.

    For example, 

     try(
     FastqFileDataStore datastore = new FastqFileDataStoreBuilder(fastqFile)
                                                      .hint(DataStoreProviderHint.ITERATION_ONLY)
                                                      .build();
 
      ThrowingStream<FastqRecord> stream = datastore.records();
 ){
     stream.forEach( ... );
 }

    Can now be rewritten as: 

     FastqFileReader.forEach(fastqFile,
                       (id, record) ->{ ... });
    Author:
    dkatzel
    Since:
    5.3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FastqFileReader.Results
      Results of a fastq file read operation, accessor methods can be used to get a Stream of the FastqRecords contained in the file.

    • Method Detail

      • forEach

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(File fastqFile,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use #forEach(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to read; can not be null.
        consumer - a BiConsumer that takes the id of the record as the first parameter and the record as the second parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        E extends Throwable
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser)

      • forEach

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(FastqParser fastqParser,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use #forEach(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if there are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        consumer - a BiConsumer that takes the id of the record as the first parameter and the record as the second parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        E extends Throwable
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser)

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(FastqParser fastqParser,
                                                 FastqQualityCodec codec,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use #forEach(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if there are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.
        consumer - a BiConsumer that takes the id of the record as the first parameter and the record as the second parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        E extends Throwable

      • forEach

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(FastqParser fastqParser,
                                                 FastqQualityCodec codec,
                                                 Predicate<String> idFilter,
                                                 Predicate<FastqRecord> recordFilter,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one that match the given filters. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use #forEach(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if there are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.
        idFilter - a Predicate to include only records whose by Id makes the predicate return true; if null, then no id filter is used.
        recordFilter - a Predicate to include only the parsed records that return true; if null, then no record filter is used.
        consumer - a BiConsumer that takes the id of the record as the first parameter and the record as the second parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        E extends Throwable

        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(FastqParser fastqParser,
                                                 Predicate<FastqRecord> recordFilter,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one that match the given filters. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use #forEach(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if there are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.

      • forEach

        public static <E extends Throwable> void forEach(File fastqFile,
                                                 FastqQualityCodec codec,
                                                 ThrowingBiConsumer<String,FastqRecord,E> consumer)
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 E extends Throwable
        Iterate through all the records in the datastore and call the given consumer on each one. The given FastqQualityCodec will be used to decode the quality values. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each. If the fastq has multi-line sections, use read(FastqParser).. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to read; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.
        consumer - a BiConsumer that takes the id of the record as the first parameter and the record as the second parameter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        E extends Throwable

      • read

        public static FastqFileReader.Results read(File fastqFile)
                                    throws IOException
        Get a ThrowingStream of all the fastq records and the FastqQualityCodec used in the given fastq file. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty (the file will have to be read twice, once to determine the codec, once again to parse the data) for better performance please use read(File, FastqQualityCodec) if the codec is already known. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to read; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a FastqFileReader.Results object that contains the ThrowingStream of all the FastqRecords and the FastqQualityCodec used to encode the file; will not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if fastqFile is null.
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser)

      • read

        public static FastqFileReader.Results read(FastqParser fastqParser)
                                    throws IOException
        Get a ThrowingStream of all the fastq records and the FastqQualityCodec used in the given fastq file. The FastqQualityCodec that is used to encode this file will be automatically detected for a performance penalty This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each. If the fastq has multi-line sections, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if there are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a FastqFileReader.Results object that contains the ThrowingStream of all the FastqRecords and the FastqQualityCodec used to encode the file; will not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser), FastqFileParserBuilder

      • read

        public static FastqFileReader.Results read(File fastqFile,
                                           FastqQualityCodec codec)
                                    throws IOException
        Get a ThrowingStream of all the fastq records and the FastqQualityCodec used in the given fastq file using the given FastqQualityCodec to decode the quality values. This assumes each section of each fastq record is one line each and does not have comments. If the fastq has multi-line sections or comments, use read(FastqParser).
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to read; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a FastqFileReader.Results object that contains the ThrowingStream of all the FastqRecords and the FastqQualityCodec used to encode the file; will not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser)

      • read

        public static FastqFileReader.Results read(FastqParser fastqParser,
                                           FastqQualityCodec codec)
                                    throws IOException
        Get a ThrowingStream of all the fastq records and the FastqQualityCodec used in the given fastq file using the given FastqQualityCodec to decode the quality values.
        Parameters:
        fastqParser - the FastqParser that knows the input source (file or inputstream), how the file is compressed, and if thre are multiline sections or comments; can not be null.
        codec - the FastqQualityCodec known to encode this file; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a FastqFileReader.Results object that contains the ThrowingStream of all the FastqRecords and the FastqQualityCodec used to encode the file; will not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the fastq file.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        See Also:
        read(File, FastqQualityCodec), read(FastqParser), FastqFileParserBuilder
